arm_group.description: Patients with severe symptomatic aortic stenosis referred for consideration of surgical aortic valve replacement

brief_summary.textblock:
Our main hypothesis on the present study is that new parameters such as risk-taking
      behavior, patients motivation, health related quality of life, new biomarkers and more
      precise echocardiography measures in addition to traditional parameters will improve
      pre-operative risk assessment in patients with AS and better guide patients and doctors in
      decision whether to operate or not.

clinical_study.brief_title: Severe Aortic Stenosis in Patients Referred for Valve Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients referred for surgery are included thorough reading referral letter. Data collected
      in the study wil be compared with data from Medical records and clinical examination.

      Data entered will be controlled by two investigators.

      Data wil be compared to national norms and from result of other studies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients above 18 years with symptomatic AS referred to preoperative examination.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Exclusion: Patients who do not want to participate. Patients not able to speak and
             read Norwegian.

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion: Patients above 18 years with symptomatic AS referred to preoperative
        examination will be included. Patients will undergo standard investigations with regard to
        assessment of the clinical indication for operation

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Longitudinal Study of Severe Aortic Stenosis in Elderly and Outcome of Aortic Surgery.

other_outcome.description: Patients in the study perform Short Form-36, EuroQual-5D at inclusion and one year after. We want to compare the result of their scoring to obtain the gain in HRQoL of the intervention
other_outcome.measure: Change in Health related Quality and function one year after inclusion
Hospital visit and use of Health services last years

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral complications (stroke/bleeding), bleeding, renal failure, arrythmias, needs for pacemaker, prolong ICU stay, wound infections

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
